intro: Haplophyllum longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved haplophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are elongated and often have a slightly woolly texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
